title: Alternating Hammer Curl
description:
Alternating Hammer Curls are a biceps and forearm workout where you lift dumbbells in a controlled, alternating fashion with a neutral grip (palms facing inward).

How to Perform:
- Stand upright with a dumbbell in each hand, arms at your sides, palms facing inward.
- Curl one dumbbell up toward your shoulder while keeping your elbow close to your body.
- Squeeze your biceps at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
- Repeat with the other arm, alternating between left and right.

Muscles Worked:
✔ Biceps brachii
✔ Brachialis (muscle underneath the biceps)
✔ Brachioradialis (forearm muscle)

This exercise helps build thicker arms by targeting the brachialis, which pushes the biceps up for a fuller look. 💪

articles.title: DO's
list: ✔ Maintain Proper Form – Keep your elbows close to your torso and avoid excessive swinging. Only your forearms should move.
✔ Engage Your Core – A tight core helps maintain balance and prevent lower back strain.
✔ Use a Controlled Motion – Lift and lower the dumbbells in a slow, controlled manner to maximize muscle engagement.
✔ Keep Your Wrists Neutral – Your palms should face inward throughout the movement (neutral grip).
✔ Squeeze at the Top – Contract your biceps at the peak of the movement for better muscle activation.
✔ Use a Full Range of Motion – Lower the dumbbell all the way down without locking out your elbows.
✔ Breathe Properly – Exhale as you lift, inhale as you lower the dumbbell.
✔ Choose the Right Weight – Use a weight that challenges you but still allows proper form.

articles.title: DONT's
list: ❌ Don’t Swing or Use Momentum – Avoid using your back or shoulders to lift the weight.
❌ Don’t Rush the Reps – Fast reps reduce time under tension and effectiveness.
❌ Don’t Lock Your Elbows – Keep a slight bend at the bottom to avoid joint strain.
❌ Don’t Shrug Your Shoulders – Keep them down to avoid unnecessary tension.
❌ Don’t Lean Back – If you have to arch your back, the weight is too heavy.
❌ Don’t Let the Dumbbells Touch Your Body – Keep a small gap to ensure proper muscle activation.
❌ Don’t Neglect the Negative Phase – Lowering the weight slowly helps with muscle growth.
